description: From omni- +â€Ž -vorous; from the Latin omni, all and -vore.

entries.meaning: Having a diet which is neither exclusively carnivorous nor exclusively herbivorous.
(figuratively) Having an interest in a variety of subjects.
examples: The Beckettian progression appears occasionally: while Miss Counihan (static) is an omnivorous reader and Murphy (transitional) a strict non-reader, Cooper is an analphabete.
